Name: oid
Description: Row identifier (hidden attribute; must be explicitly\nselected)

Name: lanispl
Description: This is false for internal languages (such as SQL) and true for user-defined languages.\nCurrently, pg_dump still uses this to determine which languages need to be dumped, but this might be replaced by a different mechanism in the future.

Name: lanpltrusted
Description: True if this is a trusted language, which means that it is\nbelieved not to grant access to anything outside the normal SQL execution environment. Only superusers can create functions in untrusted languages.

Name: lanplcallfoid
Description: For noninternal languages this references the language handler,\nwhich is a special function that is responsible for executing all functions that are written in the particular language

Name: laninline
Description: This references a function that is responsible for executing\n"inline" anonymous code blocks (DO blocks). Zero if inline blocks are not supported.

Name: lanvalidator
Description: This references a language validator function that is\nresponsible for checking the syntax and validity of new functions when they are created. Zero if no validator is provided.

Name: lanacl
Description: Access privileges; see GRANT and\nREVOKE for details
